question: Which is the only country in the world that forms the habitat of "Mountain nyala"?
explanation: Mountain nyala is an endangered antelope species, according to the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species, found in high altitude woodland in a small part of central Ethiopia. It is a monotypic species without any identified subspecies. Bale Mountains National Park undertook the conservation of mountain nyalas, which are endemic to the Ethiopian Highlands east of the Rift Valley.
